meanings.sent1: The staker placed a bet on the horse race.
meanings.sent2: The staker won a lot of money at the poker game.
meanings.sent3: The staker was confident in their horse racing prediction.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled staker, always knowing which team would win.
meanings.sent5: The staker's lucky charm never failed to bring them success.

meanings.definition: A person who supports or defends a claim or position.
meanings.sent1: As a staker of the new policy, he defended it passionately.
meanings.sent2: The staker of the theory presented strong arguments in its favor.
meanings.sent3: The staker's unwavering support for the idea was admirable.
meanings.sent4: She was a loyal staker of her friend's decisions.
meanings.sent5: The staker's belief in the cause never wavered.

meanings.definition: A pointed stick or post driven into the ground to support a plant or mark a boundary.
meanings.sent1: The gardener used a staker to support the tomato plant.
meanings.sent2: He placed a staker to mark the edge of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the staker for a nut.
meanings.sent4: The staker stood tall, guiding the growth of the young tree.
meanings.sent5: The colorful ribbon fluttered from the top of the staker.
